name: Peanut Butter Chickpea Cookie Pie Recipe
description: Peanut Butter Chickpea Cookie Pie. Chickpea Peanut Butter Cookies. Deep dish Cookie Pie. Fudgy Chocolate Chip Chickpea Cookie Pie Recipe. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Recipe. Makes 1 8 inch pan

video.name: Peanut Butter Chickpea Cookie Pie | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Chickpea Peanut Butter Cookie Pie. 
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2017/05/peanut-butter-chickpea-cookie-pie.html

This Peanut Butter Chickpea cookie pie is fudgy, chocolatey, crispy on the edges, gooey in the middle and just perfect all around. There is no flavor of the chickpeas. Serve these with your favorite vegan ice cream or as is. I like to make the pie skinnier than a deep dish cookie pie to allow it to crisp and cook evenly and be more cookie like. Other beans such as white beans or navy beans should work as well. This recipe is Gluten-free and can be made Nut-free with sun butter. See the post for substitution details.

The batter can also be baked into blondie bars. Double the recipe, put everything in a food processor, blend, spread into a pan, and bake into a 9 by 9 brownie pan. Some canned chickpeas are drier than others, and some nut butters bake up differently as well,  so adjust the baking time to make fudgy or more crisp cookie like pie to preference.

recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup oat flour (certified gluten-free if needed *, or use regular flour)
1 cup cooked chickpeas (drained if using canned)
2 tbsp coconut oil (refined if you dont want the coconut flavor)
1/3 cup nut butter such as peanut (almond or cashew, or use sunbutter to make nut-free)
3 to 4 tbsp coconut sugar or other sugar
1/8 to 1/4 tsp salt (depends on if the nut butter and chickpeas are already salted)
1/2 cup vegan chocolate chips or chunks

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F / 180ºc.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F / 180ºc.

recipeInstructions.text: Add all the ingredients except chocolate chips to a food processor. Process for half a minute, scrape sides and process again until smooth. Taste and adjust sweet if needed. (If the mixture is too stiff, add a tbsp or more aquafaba or non dairy milk and blend in. See pictures for texture).
recipeInstructions.name: Add all the ingredients except chocolate chips to a food processor. Process for half a minute, scrape sides and process again until smooth. Taste and adjust sweet if needed. (If the mixture is too stiff, add a tbsp or more aquafaba or non dairy milk and blend in. See pictures for texture).

recipeInstructions.text: Reserve a tbsp of chocolate chips for garnish. Fold in the rest of the chocolate chips into the thick batter in the processor.
recipeInstructions.name: Reserve a tbsp of chocolate chips for garnish. Fold in the rest of the chocolate chips into the thick batter in the processor.

recipeInstructions.text: Grease or line an 8 inch or smaller cake pan. Transfer the batter onto the pan and spread it out using a spatula. Sprinkle chocolate chips on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Grease or line an 8 inch or smaller cake pan. Transfer the batter onto the pan and spread it out using a spatula. Sprinkle chocolate chips on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 22 to 26 minutes or until the center looks set. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then slice and serve with dollop of vegan vanilla ice cream or whipped coconut cream, and melted chocolate or vegan caramel.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 22 to 26 minutes or until the center looks set. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then slice and serve with dollop of vegan vanilla ice cream or whipped coconut cream, and melted chocolate or vegan caramel.
